intro: Thesium macrocarpon, commonly known as the large-fruited thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is closely related to the grass family. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Thesium macrocarpon is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
